questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: A weather watch would probably be issued for which of the following conditions?
questions.answer: A) there is a chance for tornadoes tomorrow

mcq.option: A) there is a chance for tornadoes tomorrow
B) presently, extremely high winds are occurring at mountain summits
C) a tornado has been sighted at the outskirts of town
D) heavy snow has been falling over the forecast area

questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: How does the average speed of air molecules relate to the air temperature?
questions.answer: Higher temperatures correspond to faster average speeds and lower temperatures to slower average speeds.

questions.title: Question 3 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: Michigan Stadium contains multiple materials from the grass(?) on the field to the concrete and metal of the seats. On top of that it has multiple slopes which will increase or decrease the sunlight exposure around the stadium. We will be visiting Michigan Stadium on a hopefully sunny day to be determined to make measurements of the temperatures around the bowl of the stadium. What spot in the stadium would you expect to have the warmest surface?
questions.answer: Virtually any answer is OK as long as it's in the stadium amd likely in the sunshine.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: Climate models predict that if average global temperatures rise by about 3 degrees C average global precipitation will:

mcq.option: D) vary from year to year

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_190913

questions.title: Question 7 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: Without the atmospheric greenhouse effect the average surface temperature would be:

mcq.option: C) the same as it is now
D) much more variable than it is now

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: Which of the following climatic regions would probably have the largest daily temperature range?

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: The largest snowflakes would probably be observed in _____ air whose temperature is ____ freezing.

questions.title: Question 10 for Class CLIMATE102_190913
questions.main: A frontal inversion would probably be best observed:
questions.answer: D) with a warm front in winter

mcq.option: A) with a warm front in summer
B) with a stationary front in winter
C) with a cold front is summer
D) with a warm front in winter
